timeline.message: NXP-28604: Prevent replace main content document which is stored in cold storage

NXP-28604: Prevent replace main content document which is stored in cold storage

timeline.bodyText: You could use document instead of its id to log more information.
timeline.author: ataillefer

timeline.bodyText: Don't we want to use DocumentModel#refresh now @efge ?
timeline.author: ataillefer

replies.bodyText: Yes it's shorter and more explicit but no big deal.
replies.author: efge

timeline.author: ataillefer
ataillefer

replies.bodyText: the reload of the document is needed otherwise my test fail, because before this part of the test I tried to update the blob, if i don't reload it i will find myself with a document contains the new blob.
replies.author: RSalem07

replies.bodyText: but we can use refresh instead of the getDocument
replies.author: RSalem07

timeline.author: ataillefer

replies.bodyText: yep 👍 and i tried using directly the org.junit.Assert#assertEquals(java.lang.Object, java.lang.Object) and it works fine. if you agree i can use it.
replies.author: RSalem07

replies.bodyText: I would suggest using CollectionUtils otherwise we're relying on the equals method of the asserted object. This could not work as expected, in our case, we probably have an ArrayList which has a correct equals implementation. But we shouldn't leverage it.
replies.author: kevinleturc

replies.bodyText: For collections I don't see a problem with using assertEquals, their equals method are supposed to do the right thing by definition.
replies.author: efge

replies.bodyText: I agree with you that almost all implementations have a good implementation for equals, but not all. Which forces us to use CollectionUtils if we want a coding convention.
replies.author: kevinleturc

timeline.author: troger

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
             * A synchronous listener that prevents any main content document replacement when it's stored in cold storage.
          
          
            
             * A synchronous listener that prevents any document's main content replacement when it's stored in cold storage.
          
      
    
    
  

Or just

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
             * A synchronous listener that prevents any main content document replacement when it's stored in cold storage.
          
          
            
             * A synchronous listener that prevents any main content replacement when it's stored in cold storage.
